meanings.definition: To surpass in fawning over someone or something.
meanings.sent1: She tried to outfawn her classmates by complimenting the teacher every day.
meanings.sent2: The new student quickly learned to outfawn the principal to get special privileges.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to outfawn the dog by purring loudly whenever the owner was around.
meanings.sent4: The politician's attempt to outfawn his opponent backfired when voters saw through his insincerity.
meanings.sent5: The little girl's efforts to outfawn her parents with hugs and kisses were endearing.

meanings.sent1: He would always outfawn his boss with compliments to get a promotion.
meanings.sent2: The celebrity would outfawn the interviewer with fake smiles and exaggerated praise.
meanings.sent3: The salesman tried to outfawn the customer by showering them with false compliments.
meanings.sent4: Her attempts to outfawn her way into the group's inner circle were met with skepticism.
meanings.sent5: The politician's speech was filled with outfawning remarks to win over the crowd.
